basics.name: Tina Loos
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii at Mānoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2022.

courses: ICS 390: Computing Ethics for Lab Assistants

work.position: Learning Assistant & Assisting Teaching Assistant for Computer Science
highlights: Teach lessons during recitation lab sessions (PowerPoint)
Tutor students taking computer science courses at UH Mānoa
Hold office hours to help students learn concepts
Tour new students around campus while informing them of the opportunities available
Facilitate small group activities to foster education and friendship
Assist in running the @newrainbowwarriororientation Instagram page

work.company: National Center for Women and Information Technology
highlights: $3000 grant recipient (funded by Intel, Northrop Grumman, and Google)
Created and led my AspireIT K-12 Outreach Program to unite girls in STEM and close the gender gap
Taught computer science to students in grades 5-8 (developed lesson plans and budgeted expenses)

work.company: Patsy T. Mink Center for Business and Leadership
highlights: Edited websites for the Patsy T. Mink Center for Business and Leadership (Squarespace)
Co-authored and created an e-book; designed informative notebook pages, flyers, and logos
Assisted in running various Instagram and Facebook accounts for the company and its affiliates

volunteer.organization: Association for Computing Machinery - UH Mānoa
highlights: SWITCH-UHM: Promote women in IT thorough mentorship, workshops, and awareness
ACI: attend weekly meetings to develop my understanding of algorithms
Conducted qualitative research on the applications of artificial intelligence
Piloted three interviews with AI experts: professor, researcher, and industry professional
Working toward the goal of a publishable paper
Assisted in organizing YWCA's first Girls' Summit Youth Program
Taught STEM and served as mentor to middle school girls
Advocated against child abuse with the Scream. Run. Tell. organization

awards.title: Golden Key International Honor Society
awards.summary: The world's largest collegiate honor society for graduate and undergraduate students, built on the pillars of academics, leadership, and service.

awards.title: National Society of Leadership and Success
awards.summary: The nation's largest leadership honor society, where top students nominated by their colleges come together to identify and achieve their goals.

awards.title: National Society of Collegiate Scholars
awards.summary: Honors high achievers and inspires them to live and lead with integrity while transforming the world in a positive way

awards.title: Miss Teen Waikiki
awards.summary: Awards: Top Scholar; Spirit of Aloha (greatest community service impact);

awards.title: National Honorable Mention for Aspirations in Computing
awards.awarder: National Center for Women and Information Technology
